intro: Ophiorrhiza heterostyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and delicate white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Ophiorrhiza heterostyla is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
